member.summary: Reference to the containing profiler, allowing this Timing to affect the Head and get Stopwatch readings.

member.name: F:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing._startTicks
member.summary: Offset from parent MiniProfiler's creation that this Timing was created.

member.summary: Creates a new Timing named 'name' in the 'profiler's session, with 'parent' as this Timing's immediate ancestor.

member.summary: Obsolete - used for serialization.

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.AddKeyValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds arbitrary string 'value' under 'key', allowing custom properties to be stored in this Timing step.

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Stop
member.summary: Completes this Timing's duration and sets the MiniProfiler's Head up one level.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Id
member.summary: Unique identifer for this timing; set during construction.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Name
member.summary: Text displayed when this Timing is rendered.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.DurationMilliseconds
member.summary: How long this Timing step took in ms; includes any Timings' durations.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.StartMilliseconds
member.summary: The offset from the start of profiling.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Children
member.summary: All sub-steps that occur within this Timing step. Add new children through

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.KeyValues
member.summary: Stores arbitrary key/value strings on this Timing step. Add new tuples through .

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.SqlTimings
member.summary: Any queries that occurred during this Timing step.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Parent
member.summary: Which Timing this Timing is under - the duration that this step takes will be added to its parent's duration.
member.remarks: This will be null for the root (initial) Timing.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.DurationWithoutChildrenMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets the ellapsed milliseconds in this step without any children's durations.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.SqlTimingsDurationMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets the aggregate ellapsed milliseconds of all SqlTimings executed in this Timing, excluding Children Timings.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.IsTrivial
member.summary: Returns true when this is less than the configured , by default 2.0 ms.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.HasChildren
member.summary: Returns true when this Timing has inner Timing steps.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.HasSqlTimings
member.summary: Returns true if this Timing step collected sql execution timings.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.HasDuplicateSqlTimings
member.summary: Returns true if any s executed in this step are detected as duplicate statements.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.IsRoot
member.summary: Returns true when this Timing is the first one created in a MiniProfiler session.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Depth
member.summary: How far away this Timing is from the Profiler's Root.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.ExecutedReaders
member.summary: How many sql data readers were executed in this Timing step.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.ExecutedScalars
member.summary: How many sql scalar queries were executed in this Timing step.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.ExecutedNonQueries
member.summary: How many sql non-query statements were executed in this Timing step.

member.summary: Returns an that will time the code between its creation and disposal. Use this method when you do not wish to include the MvcMiniProfiler namespace for the extension method.

This step's visibility level; allows filtering when is called.

Whether to show trivial timings by default (defaults to false)
Whether to show time the time with children column by default (defaults to false)
member.returns: Script and link elements normally; an empty string when there is no active profiling session.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.ElapsedTicks
member.summary: Ticks since this MiniProfiler was started.

member.summary: Points to the currently executing Timing.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Current
member.summary: Gets the currently running MiniProfiler for the current HttpContext; null if no MiniProfiler was ed.

member.name: T:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings
member.summary: Various configuration properties.

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.EnsureCacheMethods
member.summary: When setters are null, creates default getters and setters that operate on the HttpRuntime.Cache.
member.remarks: Our MiniProfiler must have these to run.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.WriteScriptsToResponseOnStop
member.summary: When true, link and script tags will be written to the response stream when MiniProfiler.Stop is called.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.TrivialDurationThresholdMilliseconds
member.summary: Any Timing step with a duration less than or equal to this will be hidden by default in the UI; defaults to 2.0 ms.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.RenderPopupButtonOnRight
member.summary: Dictates on which side of the page the profiler popup button is displayed; defaults to false (i.e. renders on left side).

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.IgnoredRootPaths
member.summary: When is called, if the current request url starts with this property, no profiler will be instantiated and no results will be displayed. Default value is { "/mini-profiler-includes.js", "/mini-profiler-includes.less", "/mini-profiler-results", "/content/", "/scripts/" }.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.ShortTermCacheGetter
member.summary: A method that will return a MiniProfiler when given a Guid. Meant for caching individual page profilings for a very limited time.
member.remarks: By default, MiniProfilers will be cached for 5 minutes in the HttpRuntime.Cache. This can be extended when the cache is shared from its top link.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.ShortTermCacheSetter
member.summary: A method that will save a MiniProfiler into a short-duration cache, so results can fetched down to the client after page load. It is important that you cache the MiniProfiler under its Id, a Guid - this Id will be passed to the ShortTermCacheGetter.
member.remarks: By default, MiniProfilers will be cached for 5 minutes in the HttpRuntime.Cache.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.LongTermCacheGetter
member.summary: A method that will return a MiniProfiler when given a Guid. Meant for caching profilings for an extended period of time, so they may be shared with others.
member.remarks: This is used by the full page results view, which is linked in the popup's header.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.LongTermCacheSetter
member.summary: A method that will save a MiniProfiler, identified by its Guid Id, into long-term storage. Allows results to be shared with others. It is important that you cache the MiniProfiler under its Id, a Guid - this Id will be passed to the LongTermCacheGetter.
member.remarks: This is activated EVERY TIME the top left header link is clicked in the popup UI and the full page results view is displayed. When overriding the default, your code will need to handle setting the same profiler back into your chosen storage medium (e.g. no-op when it already exists).

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.Version
member.summary: Assembly version of this dank MiniProfiler.

member.name: T:MvcMiniProfiler.Data.Link`2
member.summary: This is a micro-cache; suitable when the number of terms is controllable (a few hundred, for example), and strictly append-only; you cannot change existing values. All key matches are on **REFERENCE** equality. The type is fully thread-safe.
